page.title: 12MARKET WESTON FEN
page.content: One of the best remaining examples of the valley fens along the Little Ouse & Waveney Valleys. It has so far escaped the drainage & bore hole extraction which is so harmful to valley fens.The sedge beds support fen specialtities such as grass of Parnassus & marsh helleborine. A part of the area is dry heath with gorse,blackthorn & bracken. There are some isolated ponds with a good variety of plants & insects. Snipe,water rail, warblers, nightingales & dragonfly all abound. The fen was sold,by the Parish,in 1981 to the Suffolk Trust for Nature Conservation.The lack of recent manage- ment & build up of thick letter layer is suppressing some important plants. The re-establishment of traditional mowing & grazing etc will ensure the maintenance of the habitat diveristy. A warden organises voluntary workers.
